title: Kazan
summary: Kazan (/kəˈzæn, -ˈzɑːn/ kə-ZAN, -⁠ZAHN; Russian: Каза́нь; Tatar: Казан IPA: [qɑzan])[14] is the capital and largest city of the Republic of Tatarstan in Russia. The city lies at the confluence of the Volga and the Kazanka rivers, covering an area of 425.3 square kilometres (164.2 square miles), with a population of over 1.2 million residents,[15] up to roughly 1.6 million residents in the urban agglomeration. Kazan is the fifth-largest city in Russia, and the most populous city on the Volga, as well as the Volga Federal District.
